page.title: 01SMALLBURGH AND DILHAM
page.content: The area contains two villages Smallburgh and Dilham. The river Ant crosses the area from south east to the north west corner. There is a predominance of fenland. The inhabitants either work in asgriculture, in local small businesses or commute to Norwich. There are a few holiday homes. Two village halls serve the area. The one in Dilham has been in existance for many years, Smallburgh's hall has just been completed. Activities in the area include W.I. pre-school playgroup and fottball club. Wayford Bridge is a road crossing and is a busy area for holiday makers providing boat hire and moorings. Both villages have a public staithe providing the launching of boats by the general public. The area supports two large dairy herds. The two village schools were closed in
